title: A  Open-Label, Active-Controlled Multi-Center Study of OST-957 (cathepsin K inhibitor) in Patients With Alzheimer's Disease
officialTitle: A  Open-Label, Active-Controlled Multi-Center Study of OST-957 (cathepsin K inhibitor) in Patients With Alzheimer's Disease
description: This is a  open-label, active-controlled multi-center study designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of OST-957 (cathepsin K inhibitor) in patients with Alzheimer's Disease. The study will enroll approximately 208 patients.
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 21-79 years
- Confirmed diagnosis of Alzheimer's Disease
- ECOG performance status 0-1
- Adequate organ function
- Willing and able to provide informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to study drug or excipients
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Participation in another interventional study within 30 days
- Significant cardiovascular disease within past 6 months
- Active or chronic infection requiring systemic treatment
